glossentry.glossdef:
A group of bitter and astringent organic substances, can be found richly in nature. They’re present in the wood, bark, leaves and fruit of plants as various as oak, rhubarb, tea, walnut, cranberry, cacao and grapes.
Plants have tannins to make themselves tasteless. Their purpose in nature is to repel animals from eating a plant’s fruit or seeds before it’s ripe.
